description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education and other institutions in charge of education for children and adolescents, offer well- structured and relevant education alternatives, which lead to a decrease in school exclusion, particularly in areas with higher exclusion levels, populations with disabilities and other vulnerable groups, all in accordance with diverse intercultural settings.

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Costa Rica United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Costa Rica Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Education)

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/001 INCLUSIVE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Education and other institutions in charge of education for children and adolescents, offer well- structured and relevant education alternatives, which lead to a decrease in school exclusion, particularly in areas with higher exclusion levels, populations with disabilities and other vulnerable groups, all in accordance with diverse intercultural settings.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Ministry of Public Education (MEP) in the design of the National Strategy to Address Educational Exclusion, with special attention to the most vulnerable areas and populations. Technical assistance was also provided to the National Institute of Apprenticeship (INA) in designing its National Anti-exclusion Strategy for Technical and Informal Training Programs. In the framework of the collaboration between UNICEF and INA, actions were developed to strengthen the public offer of technical training in early childhood and adolescent development. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/02/2020

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Skills - National curricula and training support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance
Percentage of adolescents who succeed in completing secondary education in a timely manner.
Number of highly vulnerable municipalities with joint educational services.

baseline.value: Baseline to be developed in the first half of 2018.

target.value: 2022:Baseline to be developed in the first half of 2018.

title.narrative: Student governments in areas of greater exclusion have participatory and advocacy mechanisms in their education centers.

baseline.value: Education centers dont offer student governments adequate participatory and advocacy mechanisms.

target.value: 2022:One third of student governments in high-exclusion areas have leading roles in policy-building processes at their education centers through participatory and advocacy mechanisms.

title.narrative: The evaluation of the "Yo Me Apunto" / Exclusin Strategy Program has been carried out.

baseline.value: The Yo Me Apunto program is a successful strategy that strives to reduce school exclusion that hasnt been evaluated.

target.value: 2022:The Evaluation of "Yo Me Apunto"led to the strengthening and upscaling of the program.

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has worked along with its counterparts of the Ministry of Education and the Central American Educational and Cultural Coordination conducted a systematic review and an analytical report of the country exclusion strategy was finalized.
